faqSection.title: Crucial Answers About Renting a Shop Space in Sector 60 Gurugram
faqSection.description: Get essential information regarding lease agreements security deposits maintenance charges and the legal requirements for commercial rentals in this growing sector.

faqs.question: What is the typical lock-in period for a shop for rent in Sector 60
faqs.answer: The standard lock-in period for commercial rentals in Sector 60 Gurugram usually ranges between 12 to 36 months depending on the size of the space and the nature of the development. For large showrooms or anchor stores, owners often seek longer commitments up to 60 months. This period ensures stability for both the tenant and the landlord. We assist in negotiating lock-in terms that align best with your operational setup and investment horizon.

faqs.question: How much security deposit is required when renting a commercial shop in this area
faqs.answer: Generally landlords in Sector 60 require a security deposit equivalent to 3 to 6 months' rent. This deposit is refundable at the end of the lease term provided all terms and conditions particularly concerning property condition and outstanding dues are met. The exact amount is always subject to negotiation and is influenced by the tenant’s profile and the perceived risk of the business.

faqs.question: Are there specific building restrictions for retail businesses in Sector 60
faqs.answer: Commercial properties in Sector 60 are governed by the specific zoning and municipal corporation guidelines of Gurugram. Restrictions often apply to structural alterations signage sizes and the use of hazardous materials. Businesses operating in the food and beverage industry must also secure specific health and fire safety clearances. We verify that the potential shop space is legally cleared for your intended commercial activity.

faqs.question: What documents are needed to finalize a shop rental agreement in Sector 60
faqs.answer: To finalize a shop rental agreement you will typically need a copy of your Aadhar card PAN card proof of business registration or incorporation documents GST registration certificate and bank statements. Both the landlord and tenant must ensure the lease deed is properly stamped and registered to be legally enforceable in court.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for repairs and maintenance of the rented shop space
faqs.answer: The division of maintenance responsibilities is clearly defined in the lease agreement. Typically the tenant is responsible for internal wear and tear minor repairs and fittings. The landlord usually covers structural repairs external façade maintenance and common area services like lifts and building security. Review the agreement carefully regarding HVAC systems and electrical fixtures.

faqs.question: What are the common area maintenance CAM charges in Sector 60 commercial complexes
faqs.answer: CAM charges cover the operating expenses of the common areas of the commercial building such as security lighting cleaning landscaping and property management salaries. These charges vary widely but are generally calculated per square foot per month and are paid separately from the base rent. Understanding the inclusions in the CAM charge is essential for accurate budgeting.

faqs.question: Can I renovate or modify the interior of a rented shop
faqs.answer: Yes interior modifications are generally permitted but require written consent from the landlord before commencement. Minor cosmetic changes are usually acceptable but major structural changes or modifications to the building's facade are typically restricted. All approved changes must comply with local building codes and are often required to be reverted upon lease expiry unless specified otherwise.

faqs.question: Is Sector 60 well-connected for logistics and customer access
faqs.answer: Yes Sector 60 enjoys excellent connectivity. It is strategically located near major arterial roads like the Gurugram-Bypass Road and provides easy access to the Gurgaon-Mumbai Expressway network. This ensures smooth logistics operations and convenient travel for customers coming from Gurgaon Noida and other parts of Gurugram.

faqs.question: What type of businesses thrive best with a shop for rent in Sector 60
faqs.answer: Given the dense residential population surrounding Sector 60 businesses catering to daily necessities and aspirational spending tend to thrive. These include premium grocery stores specialty clinics educational coaching centers high-end salons and quick-service restaurants QSRs.

faqs.question: How long does it take to secure and move into a rented shop space
faqs.answer: The timeline can range from 15 days to 45 days. This duration depends primarily on the negotiation period the time required for background checks due diligence and the legal drafting and registration of the lease agreement. Choosing a ready-to-move unit significantly shortens the physical preparation time.
